Title: Kotch

Cast: Walter Matthau, Deborah Winters, Felicia Farr, Charles Aidman, Ellen Geer, Donald Kowalski, Dean Kowalski, Arlen Stuart, Jane Connell, James Brodhead, Jessica Rains, Darrell Larson, Biff Elliot, Paul Picerni, Lucy Saroyan

See full summary » Avoiding to settle in a nursing home, Joseph Kotcher, a retired salesman, is obliged to leave his son's family. He embarks on a road trip during which he strikes up a friendship with a pregnant teenager and begins to understand the true meaning of life as he helps the girl give birth to her child. Written by Anonymous
Keywords: teenage pregnancy, gas station restroom, one word title, old age, senility
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 3 wins & 4 nominations.
Location: Palm Springs Aerial Tramway, Palm Springs, California, USA
Actors: Walter Matthau, Deborah Winters, Felicia Farr
Description: Directed by Jack Lemmon.  With Walter Matthau, Deborah Winters, Felicia Farr, Charles Aidman. Avoiding to settle in a nursing home, Joseph Kotcher, a retired salesman, is obliged to leave his son's family. He embarks on a road trip during which he strikes up a friendship with a pregnant teenager and begins to understand the true meaning of life as he helps the girl give birth to her child.
